name: Scott Dexter
content: Scott D. Dexter Scott Dexter Professor of Computer and Information Science Brooklyn College and the Graduate Center Director of the Roberta S. Matthews Center for Teaching, Brooklyn College City University of New York sdexter @t sci .dot. brooklyn .dot. cuny .dot. edu 718.951.5000 x2048 0113 N (basement of Old Ingersoll) Fall 2018 office hours W 5:00pmâ€“6:00pm; & by appointment Current Teaching CISC 3115: Introduction to Modern Programming Techniques PublicationsOfficial College Profile Curriculum Vitae (August 2018) Current Projects The American Android Supported by fellowships from the Brooklyn College Wolfe Institute for the Humanities and the PSC-CUNY Fellowship (i.e. sabbatical) program. Book manuscript in progress. A Player and a Gentleman: The Diary of Harry Watkins, Nineteenth-Century U.S. American Actor Critical (print) and digital edition of the 1200-page diary of a 19th century actor, forthcoming from University of Michigan Press, October 2018. I serve as Director of Technology, writing custom code for the Drupal-powered site, consulting on TEI usage, and writing XSLT to support transcription, proofreading, and publication. BooksDecoding Liberation: The Promise of Free and Open Source Software Introduction to Programming Using Java: An Object-Oriented Approach (2nd Edition)
